pageContext.claim: “If you took zero tolerance away, you would be overrun as a country. You'd have millions of people pouring through our border. If you took zero tolerance away, everybody would come, right now. They'd be getting their little belongings, unfortunately, and they would be heading up. You would be -- you would have a run on this country the likes of which nobody's ever seen.”
pageContext.analysis: The Trump administration's zero tolerance policy took effect in April 2018. Trump was in office for more than a year without it, and there were not "millions of people pouring through our border." The same is true for previous administrations.
